meanings.definition: To move unsteadily back and forth
meanings.sent1: The toddler was teetering on the edge of the playground equipment.
meanings.sent2: The old chair was teetering on its last leg.
meanings.sent3: The penguin looked like it was teetering on a tightrope, trying to impress its friends.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were teetering between joy and sadness.
meanings.sent5: The tower of blocks was teetering precariously before it finally toppled over.

meanings.definition: To be on the brink of falling or collapsing
meanings.sent1: The vase was teetering on the edge of the table, ready to fall.
meanings.sent2: The economy is teetering on the verge of a recession.
meanings.sent3: The cake was teetering on the edge of disaster, but somehow turned out delicious.
meanings.sent4: His grades were teetering dangerously close to failing.
meanings.sent5: The relationship was teetering on the edge of breakup, but they managed to work things out.
